website_summaries.verdict: Better than the P1, the P2 is a highly affordable first rung on the NVMe ladder. But, those wanting encryption, or higher capacities, need to look elsewhere.

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a week and then failed. No longer detected in BIOS. Not happy. Have tried everything to detect it again. Full BIOS reset did not work so must be defective. At all points during installation I had an anti static strap so I did not damage myself.
customer_reviews.author: MR T J G SHANAHAN

customer_reviews.title: Thinking the P2 was better than the P1, NOT!
customer_reviews.text: Using HDTune to read blocks, its was <100mb/s when reading written blocks. I know you can get other benchmarks, but when your reading large files. It isnt worth the money for speed. If you write blank it goes back up, but I still prefer drives like Samsung, even though more costly. Good enough for your first out for the money, but for speed/reliability, nope aint gonan touch another one.
customer_reviews.author: Mr David Gibbs

customer_reviews.title: Awesome SSD.
customer_reviews.text: Its Amazing Product..comes with Cloning And Firmware update software..Cloning was very easy and quick..Installed in my Acer Swift 3 flawlessly..Speed as Per Crucial mention..Awesome!!..A bit worried because its a P2 No P1.Called the CS about the compatibility.They Cant answer..Prob this a new product, just came out in April 20 i think.Really recomended this nvme SDD. I put also the comparison speed between HD vs Crucial P2 SSD and inside SF314-54G.
customer_reviews.author: Nirvana

customer_reviews.title: Very very quick!
customer_reviews.text: So far is super quick and noticeably better than hdd for just about everything!
customer_reviews.author: storme909

customer_reviews.title: Trouble in initialising the disk.
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble to initialise the disk as windows couldn't initialise it in the first place and gave error. I called the customer service but they could not give solution. I looked for a solution for couple of days. Finally got solution on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Abdus Satter

customer_reviews.title: Warning, might be better to look at another SSD
customer_reviews.text: So be warning, I wasted all day on this, on first power up I got a BIOS message warning that failure of a hard drive was imminent. Spent hours on the phone with Crucial’s so called support. Was told SSD fine it was a motherboard fault etc etc etc. Anyway finally got an email saying it was a known problem, that they might fix it a firmware update sometime, but good not say when that might be. Amazon were really good however.
customer_reviews.author: William Hoey

customer_reviews.title: Reliable product from Crucial Semiconductor
customer_reviews.text: Bought several main memory and SSD products from Crucial over the last 20 years. Never had a problem or diappointment with any of them. This NVMe M2 SSD has been no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Wilson

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, works without fault
customer_reviews.text: Great addition to the computer offering good storage with very quick responses. I use this as my boot drive, absolutely no complaintd
customer_reviews.author: S. Couzens

customer_reviews.title: It's okay just not as a main drive
customer_reviews.text: Does the job on a budget. Just wished I knew it doesn't have a DRAM cache before buying. So longevity as a primary device is not as great. So probs going to buy a Samsung SSD soon to take over as my main drive and use this as a secondary so it undergoes less read & writes. Guess it does it's job of storage though, can't hate to much the price was good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fast drive, easy to install, easy to move Windows onto it.
customer_reviews.text: Fit into MSI Nightblade with no issues as it took like 15 minutes to add the NVME into the box, move all the data and remove old SSD. To migrate from 2.5 SSD I used Acronis software provided by a download link with this NVME.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great speed. Check compatibility.
customer_reviews.text: Had a nightmare getting it compatible with ESXi 6.7uX. It's not on the compatibility list, which I didn't check. But got it working in ESXi 6.7. But it's super fast and is working perfectly in a home server.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Daniel O Woosnam

customer_reviews.title: Product is as described
customer_reviews.text: I have done a speed test for this SSD and it does just as well as advertised. Did not have any trouble with it and it is very easy to install. I am using it on a Acer Nitro 5 An515-54. I will recommend this product as it is very good value for money as well as coming with great free customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install in my Dell Inspiron 15" laptop and made a massive difference.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Practical speed boost
customer_reviews.text: Once cloned it was easy to exchange the original hdd
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P.

customer_reviews.title: Fast and good value
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my C drive only where i install my OS. The performance is as expected very fast and with ample storage I don't have to worry about storage anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Omar Faruq

customer_reviews.title: Works like a dream, when you wake up it works some more.
customer_reviews.text: Performance is as expected, nothing to note other than thank goodness SSD's are now so affordable. Yahoo potato.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Usual Crucial quality
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace and upgrade existing SSD in Dell XPS. No problems.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommended
customer_reviews.text: Not much you can say, that’s exactly what is meant to do!!
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: The first one failed on cloning and the replacement is slow. Yes, the benchmark shows it as quick compared with the Crucial MX500 SSD, but in real life it's not as quick. I think I should have stayed with the MX500. My system: MSI Z390-A Pro with a 3.70 gigahertz Intel Core i5-9600K processor and 16GB of ram, so not a bad setup, not the best I know, but generally, for my purposes, it skips along OK. But not with the P2. I'm thinking about taking it out and reverting back to the MX500. What a waste of money. Very Disappointed!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: No no no!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After installing and cloning my ssd, I got every time I cold boot my PC a S.M.A.R.T. error saying my drive is about to fail! Apparently this is know by Crucial and will be fixed on a firmware update that god knows when it’s going to be fixed! First time buying Crucial and also last time I believe!
customer_reviews.author: Igor Silva

customer_reviews.title: Great Drive, Part Missing
customer_reviews.text: The drive arrived bang on time and securely wrapped. The packaging was sealed on arrival with the factory seal (NOY THE SUPPLIERS). Big issue, the screw that should be present in the packaging to fix the drive in place is missing. Theres a tray in the packaging for it, but no screw. They arent the boggest things in the world and could easily have been missed during quality checking in the factory. Again this is a FACTORY fault, not the supplier.
customer_reviews.author: OldPCsDontDie

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I've never had an ssd even though my pc is very good. I've just never got down to it. As soon as I put this in and migrated os to it and sorted everything out wow. My pc went from 28 seconds to 8 with this m. 2. Crystal mark showed a read of 1300 and a write of 800. The write is very strange I done it a few times and it went from 2100 to 600MB/s. Tbh I'm not bothered about the numbers I believe the experience is way more important and it's very fast. I only paid 45 pounds for the 500gb version so it's a steel. Literally 6 times faster than my 200MB/s hdd.
customer_reviews.author: Lab anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great, bang for buck.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely superior to the Stock HP M.2 in my HP Laptop. Ran benchmarks and the results are as per Crucials read and write speeds. Had no problems and it seems to run on the cool side compared with my previous M.2 which was a Toshiba. It tends to run roughly at 27c.
customer_reviews.author: fireMUNKY

customer_reviews.title: CrucialP2 CT500P 2SSD8 500GB
customer_reviews.text: Good value, nicely packaged, Arrived as advertised, very easy installation process. Now hosts my operating system with no issues. Good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be careful to back up as reliability questions.
customer_reviews.text: Died after having in computer for The last month. I had not backed up. Lost all my data. While working was good. But of not reliable will not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Pw

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to install! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Not too thick which is great! Very easy installation! And even better value, not a bad product at all! No complaints here!
customer_reviews.author: CROYZZ

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly out of the box
customer_reviews.text: No issues so far and easy to install. Price at the time of purchase was good but there are better value deals with more premium products now coming down in price.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: I suggest not to buy this M.2 SSD
customer_reviews.text: I installed it 3 days ago, was working as it should and then today it just decided to screw up. Booted my pc up, loaded to the desktop and wouldn't show my shortcuts and the taskbar started flashing. Then I booted up from my HDD and everything is perfectly fine now. So I know for a fact that this SSD is faulty!
customer_reviews.author: ki m.

customer_reviews.title: Small and compact
customer_reviews.text: easy to install, only thing that bugged me was the amazon packaging was over 4x as big as the item but i guess that cant be helped
customer_reviews.author: Spainyyy

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: works really nice, definitely good value for money, you can feel the difference between NVME and SATA speed.
customer_reviews.author: Damian Soja

customer_reviews.title: No screw!
customer_reviews.text: This ruined my day. I had to uninstall it it and go look for a screw to secure it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: I have swapped Kingston 128GB with it and it works perfect. same performance
customer_reviews.author: Vi

customer_reviews.title: Great solid performance from this SSD
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bit of kit, I use this for my system disk with Windows 10, photoshop and the like and a separate SSD for games. My computer boots to login screen in less than 20 seconds and has been rock solid in everyday use. It clones no problem, I use macrium and keep a windows clone incase windows plays stupid with updates causing more problems than it fixes these days.
customer_reviews.author: michael

product_meta.title: Crucial P2 CT500P2SSD8 500GB Internal SSD, Up to 2300 MB/s (3D NAND, NVMe, PCIe, M.2)
product_meta.description: Capacity:500 GBWhether you’re at work, in the game, or on the go, ordinary bootup speeds can frustrate your best laid plans. Good thing the Crucial P2 SSD really flies. With plenty of storage and performance accelerated by NVMe technology, the P2 has the speed and dependability you need to explore your computer’s potential.
feature_bullets: Capacities up to 500 GB with sequential reads/writes up to 2,300/940 MB/s
NVMe PCIe interface, marking the next step in storage innovation
Includes SSD management software for performance optimization, data security, and firmware updates

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars167 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
